Race.SpecificTitle: Sheriff
Clerk of Court
Council Member -- District  7
Council Member -- District 14
Justice(s) of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  8
PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 1 -- Sec. 1-06, Art. I - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 1
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to provide for the authority of the St. Tammany Parish Government to enter into cooperative endeavor agreements and intergovernmental agreements by amending Section 1-06 of Article I of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter to read as stated in Part 1 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 2 -- Sec. 1-07, Art. I - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 2
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to provide for the automatic review of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter once every fifteen (15) years through the appointment of a Charter Committee by the St. Tammany Parish Council, by amending Section 1-07 of Article I of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter to read as stated in Part 2 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 3 -- Sec. 2-07, Art. II - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 3
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to require the St. Tammany Parish Council to adopt an ordinance providing a procedure whereby interested persons shall be given an opportunity to be heard at council meetings on any matter relating to Parish Government and on the meeting agenda, by amending Section 2-07 of Article II of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter to read as stated in Part 3 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 4 -- Sec. 2-14, Art. II - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 4
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to provide for the length of time which an emergency ordinance may remain in effect, by amending Section 2-14 of Article II of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter to read as stated in Part 4 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 5 -- Sec. 4-03, Art. IV - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 5
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to provide for the legal representation of the St. Tammany Parish Government and the creation of the Legal Department, by amending Section 4-03 of Article IV of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter to read as stated in Part 5 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 6 -- Sec. 3-09, Art. III - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 6
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to provide for the powers and duties of the Parish President of St. Tammany Parish, by amending Section 3-09 of Article III of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter to read as stated in Part 6 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 7 -- Sec. 4-02, Art. IV - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 7
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to provide for the appointment, duties, and qualifications of the chief administrative officer, by amending Section 4-02 of Article IV of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter to read as stated in Part 7 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 8 -- Sec. 4-04 through 4-12, Art. IV - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 8
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to provide for personnel policies and procedures, parish departments, and administrative reorganization, by amending Sections 4-04 through 4-12 of Article IV of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter, deleting Sections 4-04 through 4-09, and renumbering said sections to read as stated in Part 8 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend. Prop. No. 9 -- Sec. 5-02, Art. V - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 9
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to provide for the preparation and adoption of the operating budget, by amending Section 5-02 of Article V of the St. Tammany Parish Home Rule Charter to read as stated in Part 9 of St. Tammany Parish Ordinance Cal. No. 5398AA as adopted on September 23, 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. 9 -- $50 Serv. Chg. - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. 9 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its governing authority, be authorized to levy and collect an annual service charge of not to exceed Fifty Dollars ($50.00) per structure or lot (an estimated $67,732.00 is reasonably anticipated to be collected for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2016 and ending with the year 2025, to persons occupying residential and non-residential structures and persons owning unoccupied structures located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District and to persons owning lots located wholly or partly within the District upon which no structure is located for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Covington -- 1% S&U - CC - 18 Yrs
Race.SummaryText:
City of Covington Proposition
(Sales Tax Extension and Rededication)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Covington, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy and collect the existing one percent (1%) sales and use tax (the "1982 Tax") authorized at elections held on September 11, 1982, April 16, 1988 and July 21, 2001, (an estimated $4,110,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for an additional eighteen (18) years from and after October 31, 2027, or until all bonds payable from said Tax are paid, whichever is later, and shall the proceeds of the Tax heretofore and hereafter collected, be used for any lawful corporate purpose of the City, including, but not limited to, funding into bonds, constructing, improving, extending, maintaining and/or operating: playgrounds and recreational facilities, public roads, streets, bridges and crossings, sewerage, garbage disposal, water works, public safety operations and facilities and other public improvements and facilities for the City, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Folsom -- .5% S&U - M&BOA - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Village of Folsom, State of Louisiana (the "Village"), under the provisions of law, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one-half of one percent (.5%) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning January 1, 2016, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on the sales of services in the Village, all as defined by law (an estimated $136,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the costs of collecting and administering the Tax) to be dedicated for the purpose of police protection for the Village of Folsom?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 7 -- 5.21 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of St. Tammany, Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of five and twenty-one hundredths (5.21) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $202,300 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: Gravity Drainage District No. 5 -- .50 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Gravity Drainage District No. 5 of the Parish of St. Tammany, Louisiana (the "District"), levy a fifty hundredths (.50) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $82,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2016 and ending with the year 2025, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating gravity drainage works for the District, including the acquisition of equipment therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No. 7 -- 3.98 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall St. Tammany Parish Recreation District No. 7, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of three and ninety-eight hundredths (3.98) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $140,509 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of 10 years, beginning with the year 2016 and ending with the year 2025, for the purpose of providing funds for acquiring, constructing, improving, equipping, maintaining and operating recreation facilities and programs, including a community recreation center?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 11 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 11 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 11 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), renew the levy and collection of a ten (10) mills ad valorem tax on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $393,841.30 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities, including equipment, and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection?
